title: Xinru Zhao
text:
Hi, there! This is my website sharing the projects I’ve finished. Feel free to check! Thank You!!

About me
I’m a Business Analytics student at UC Irvine’s Paul Merage School, with expertise in statistical analysis, marketing analytics, and machine learning.
Through projects and work experience, I’ve strengthened my data analytics skills and marketing knowledge, focusing on Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, data management and interested in leveraging my skills to figure out meaningful insights in real world.
I’m passionate about leveraging these skills in diverse industries to support company growth. Open to opportunities where I can apply my analytical abilities. Connect with me!

title: Projects
text:
HR Attrition Project(Python:ML)

Employee retention is crucial for organizational stability, as high turnover disrupts operations and increases costs. This study leverages the IBM HR Analytics Employee Attrition & Performance dataset, containing 35 attributes like satisfaction, compensation, and performance, to analyze turnover trends. By applying machine learning models—Random Forest, Logistic Regression, and K-Nearest Neighbors—the project aims to predict attrition risk, identify key factors driving employee turnover, and provide actionable insights. Understanding these patterns helps HR departments proactively retain talent, reduce recruitment expenses, and maintain a competitive edge in today’s talent-driven market, ultimately fostering a stable and productive workforce.Check out this analysis I performed by following the link here.

:::


Spam Detection Project(Python:ML+NLP)

This project builds a machine learning model to classify SMS messages as spam or ham (non-spam) using Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques. To address class imbalance, it applies SMOTE (Synthetic Minority Oversampling Technique). Various classifiers are tested, and model performance is evaluated using accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score, and AUC. The best results are achieved using a Naïve Bayes classifier with TF-IDF vectorization and N-gram features (unigram, bigram, trigram). A live demo is also developed to showcase real-time spam detection. This project highlights the importance of automated spam detection in the face of increasing spam message volume.Check out this analysis I performed by following the link here.

:::


Statistic Data Analysis Project(SPSS: Regression/Excel)

This project explores the complexity of human kissing behavior in romantic relationships, which goes beyond biological instincts to foster emotional connection. It investigates factors influencing “Kiss Frequency,” including partner attractiveness, kiss satisfaction, and broader societal influences like national GDP and the GINI index. The study aims to understand how both personal and environmental factors affect kissing habits. Unlike other animals, humans kiss more frequently in love, and this behavior may vary based on relationship type and surroundings. The analysis offers new insights into the cultural and economic aspects of kissing, with findings detailed in later sections of the report.Check out this analysis I performed by following the link here.

:::


Sun Country Airline Project(Python:K-Means/Excel/PowerBI)

This project supports Sun Country Airlines’ growth by using data-driven strategies to enhance customer engagement and loyalty. Using data from January 2013 to December 2014 (37 columns, 26,575 rows), we applied K-means Cluster Analysis and visualized results using Excel, Python, and Power BI. This enabled us to group customers by similar behaviors and preferences, supporting Precision Marketing efforts. Visualizations helped identify key segments and generate actionable insights to strengthen customer relationships and build a sustainable competitive advantage.Check out this analysis I performed by following the link here.

:::


Y Combinator Project(MySQL:Join+Subquery)

This project analyzes YC-backed startups to uncover success patterns. Using a comprehensive dataset (companies, founders, industries, regions, schools), the team designed an ER diagram and relational data model to map relationships. SQL queries revealed that 71% of startups remain active, with Consumer, Fintech, and AI industries leading. Stanford University and tech giants like Google dominate founder backgrounds. Insights suggest YC prioritize North America, India, and UK startups, and invest in founders from top schools and tech firms to boost survival rates, offering valuable data for investors and market researchers.Check out this analysis I performed by following the link here.

:::


Beyond Meat Marketing Project



This project aims to address the potential issues arising in plant-based market, especially for Beyond Meat. This project provided some suggestions for Beyond Meat in Product and Sales Channel aspects.
Check out this analysis I performed by following the link here. :::

title: Employee Retention & Performance Analysis for HR Decision-Making
text:
Finish Date:2024-12-06

Introduction
Employee retention is a critical challenge for organizations, as high turnover rates can disrupt operations, increase recruitment and training costs, and negatively impact team dynamics and morale. Addressing this issue is vital for maintaining a stable workforce and ensuring organizational success. The business idea underpinning this analysis focuses on leveraging data-driven insights to proactively identify at-risk employees and implement effective retention strategies.
This study utilizes the IBM HR Analytics Employee Attrition & Performance dataset, which includes detailed information related to employee retention across 35 attributes. These attributes span various dimensions such as environmental satisfaction, compensation, and job performance ratings with an “Attrition” variable, indicating whether an employee has left the company, making it an ideal resource for analyzing turnover trends. The importance of this project lies in its potential to address a pressing business problem by combining advanced analytical techniques with real-world HR data. Organizations today face increasing competition for talent, and understanding the drivers of employee attrition is crucial for retaining top performers and maintaining a competitive edge. Through the application of machine learning models such as Random Forest, Logistic Regression, and K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN), this analysis aims to build a robust predictive framework for identifying attrition risk. These methods allow us to uncover key patterns in employee behavior, identify influential factors contributing to turnover, and offer actionable recommendations to help HR departments enhance employee retention and overall organizational stability.

Visualizations
